frameDefinitions: In this frame, which is a  part of the Trial sequence, a Judge gives a Finding with respect to the Charges against the Defendant in a particular Case.
A Speaker addresses an Addressee with a Message, which may be indirectly referred to as a Topic.
In this frame, the Patient, an inorganic item, undergoes a chemical process caused by another entity, which renders it less useful, desirable or stable.
A Speaker conveys a Message to an Experiencer in order to reassure them about a Situation; Medium and the Means of the communication also may be expressed.
A Speaker reveals Information that was previously secret to an Addressee.
A Speaker succeeds in getting an Addressee to believe or plan to execute the Content the Speaker has in mind.
frameExamples: He was <t>convicted</t> of fraud by Judge Judy.
The metal was <t>corroded</t> by the water.
We <t>reassured</t> him that his decision was sound.
Could it be true that Martin himself was the one who <t>spilled</t> the <t>beans</t> on Pops and Brad's planned wedding?
At one point, Walter tries to <t>convince</t> his wife that he has had a story accepted by BBC Radio.
listRoleDefinitions: The <fen>Judge</fen> (which may be the jury, judge, magistrate or court) decides on the <fen>Finding</fen>.
This role identifies the outcome of the <fen>Judge</fen>'s deliberation or consideration. Many LUs in this frame incorporate this FE.
The person who stands accused of a crime and is subject to the verdict.
This role refers to the <fen>Charges</fen> with respect to which the verdict is being given.
The <fen>Case</fen> on which the verdict is being given.
When the event occurs.
Where the event takes place.
The <fen>Speaker</fen> is the sentient entity that produces the <fen>Message</fen>.
The <fen>Addressee</fen> receives the <fen>Message</fen> from the <fen>Speaker</fen>.
The <fen>Message</fen> is the communication produced by the <fen>Speaker</fen>.
The <fen>Topic</fen> is a general description of the content of the <fen>Message</fen>.
This role is the <fen>Medium</fen> in which the <fen>Message</fen> is expressed.
The <fen>Time</fen> during which the <fen>Speaker</fen> informs the <fen>Addressee</fen> of the <fen>Message</fen>.
<fen>Place</fen> is the location in which the <fen>Speaker</fen> informs  the <fen>Addressee</fen> of the <fen>Message</fen>.
The <fen>Patient</fen>  is corroded by the <fen>Cause</fen>.
<fen>Cause</fen> identifies an animate or inanimate entity, a force, or event that corrodes the <fen>Patient</fen>. Volitionality is not a necessary characteristic of <fen>Cause</fen>.
The individual that corrodes the <fen>Patient</fen>.
This role identifies the <fen>Time</fen> when the <fen>Cause</fen> corrodes the <fen>Patient</fen>.
This role identifies the <fen>Place</fen> where the <fen>Cause</fen> corrodes the <fen>Patient</fen>.
The sentient entity that uses language in the written or spoken modality to reassure another person.
The <fen>Experiencer</fen> receives reassurance from the <fen>Speaker</fen>.
The <fen>Message</fen> is a proposition or set of propositions that the <fen>Speaker</fen> wants the <fen>Experiencer</fen> to believe in order to feel reassured.
The <fen>Situation</fen> is the problem plaguing the <fen>Experiencer</fen>, about which the <fen>Speaker</fen>  reassures them.
The <fen>Time</fen> at which the reassurance takes place.
The <fen>Speaker</fen> is the sentient entity that reveals  the <fen>Information</fen> (whether spoken or written).
<fen>Information</fen> identifies the content that the <fen>Speaker</fen> reveals to the <fen>Addressee</fen>.  It can be expressed as a clause or as a noun phrase.
The <fen>Topic</fen> is the subject matter about which the <fen>Speaker</fen> is speaking. It normally only appears with noun targets, or in special constructions.
<fen>Medium</fen> is the physical entity or channel used by the <fen>Speaker</fen> to transmit the statement.
The <fen>Time</fen> when the revelation is made.
The role specifies the <fen>Place</fen> where the <fen>Information</fen> is revealed.
The person that the Speaker seeks to influence to act.
The person who intends through the use of language to get another person to act.
The wish for action on the <fen>Addressee</fen>'s part that the <fen>Speaker</fen> expresses.
A piece of written or spoken material that changes the mind of the <fen>Addressee</fen>.
The general item or items that are the focus of the <fen>Content</fen> of the <fen>Speaker</fen>'s message.
When the <fen>Speaker</fen> suades the <fen>Addressee</fen>.
The location where the Speaker suades the Addressee.
listRoleExamples: <fex>Bill</fex> told me that he would come to the party.
The authorities informed me <fex>that my brother had been arrested</fex>.
Leroy told his mother <fex>about his arrest</fex>.

Even when we had a size problem they informed me <fex>right away</fex> and everything worked
out great.
She looked at it for a few moments, thinking of Mark Smeaton and what he had told her <fex>on the steps of City Hall</fex>.
<fex>The metal</fex> was corroded by the water.
<fex>He</fex> reassured her that she was his favorite ice-skating star.
He tried to reassure <fex>his potential customers</fex> that his company not only offered the best service, but also the most competitive prices.
How do you reassure them <fex>that you really like them</fex>?
The policeman reassured him <fex>about the safety of the neighborhood</fex>.
<fex>Kornfeldt</fex> revealed that he had embezzled more than twice the amount his company owned.
You shouldn't reveal <fex>any murders you've been involved in</fex>, if you know what I mean.
Revelations <fex>about the coming of the Christ</fex> surfaced in early Mediaeval times.
Kim confided in me <fex>over the phone</fex>.
According to the report, he confessed to eating onions and gargling with generic mouthwash <fex>at the station</fex>.
<fex>His speech</fex> convinced me to join the Peace Corps.
You haven't convinced me <fex>about that yet</fex>.

sourceCandidateSpans.text: The Discreet Charm of the Bourgeoisie
Sunday Afternoon on the Isle of Grand Jatte
Into the Woods, the Baker's Wife
